tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE competitor_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  competitor_name VARCHAR(100),
  brand_performance FLOAT,
  marketing_strategy_adjustments TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE competitors (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100),
    industry VARCHAR(50),
    revenue DECIMAL,
    employees INT
);

CREATE TABLE brand_performance (
    brand_id INT,
    date DATE,
    revenue DECIMAL,
    impressions INT,
    clicks INT,
    PRIMARY KEY (brand_id, date)
);

CREATE TABLE competitor_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  competitor_name VARCHAR(255),
  data_type VARCHAR(50),
  value FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE brand_performance (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  brand_name VARCHAR(255),
  performance_metric VARCHAR(50),
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  value FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE marketing_strategy (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  strategy_name VARCHAR(255),
  target_audience VARCHAR(255),
  budget DECIMAL(10, 2)
)

CREATE TABLE strategy_adjustments (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  adjustment_type VARCHAR(255),
  impact_metric VARCHAR(50),
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE competitors (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255),
  industry VARCHAR(100),
  website VARCHAR(255),
  reputation INT
)

CREATE TABLE brand_metrics (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  brand_id INT,
  date DATE,
  revenue INT,
  market_share FLOAT,
  customer_satisfaction INT
)

CREATE TABLE marketing_campaigns (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  campaign_name VARCHAR(255),
  start_date DATE,
  end_date DATE,
  budget INT
)

CREATE TABLE social_media_data (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  brand_id INT,
  platform VARCHAR(50),
  followers INT,
  engagement_rate FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE website_traffic (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  brand_id INT,
  date DATE,
  visits INT,
  bounce_rate FLOAT
)
